    • Method Detail

      • sendEmail

        public static void sendEmail(int service,
             java.lang.String username,
             java.lang.String password,
             Email email)
                      throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Convenience method. Sends an e-mail using the javax.mail Library with the given service (EmailHelper.GOOGLE_APPS for example). In some cases which don't require authentication, null may be used for username and password.
        Parameters:
        service - an integer representing the service you wish to send the e-mail with. Like EmailHelper.GOOGLE_APPS.
        email - the e-mail to send
        username - the username for authentication
        password - the password for authentication
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - when trying

      • getGoogleSession

        public static javax.mail.Session getGoogleSession(java.lang.String username,
                                  java.lang.String password)
        Gets a javax.mail.Session for Google apps and Gmail. When you send your e-mail, the from address will be forced to the username you give here.
        Parameters:
        username -
        password -
        Returns:

      • zipAttachments

        public static EmailAttachment zipAttachments(java.lang.String attachmentName,
                             EmailAttachment... attachments)
                                      throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                             java.io.IOException,
                                             java.lang.Exception
        Creates a zip of the given EmailAttachments and returns an EmailAttachment of that zip with the given name.
        Parameters:
        attachmentName - the name of the newly created EmailAttachment
        attachments - the attachment(s) to be zipped
        Returns:
        the zipped version of the given attachment(s)
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.Exception
